body:
I believe that I've installed lmod recently, but when I just tried I hit this:

```
[hartzelg@rss-spack spack]$ spack -v  install lmod%gcc@5.4.0
==> Installing lmod
==> lua is already installed in /rss/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/lua-5.3.2-wkvqiqfuvioalijgr7kbrufkg4xxqkvv
==> tcl is already installed in /rss/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/tcl-8.6.5-jx7kopdjrbh4nvjz5bzvy3sltvcutsnf
==> lua-luaposix is already installed in /rss/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/lua-luaposix-33.4.0-2o4d5te2ozepcuiad7txpowbifry2rut
==> Installing lua-luafilesystem
==> lua is already installed in /rss/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/lua-5.3.2-wkvqiqfuvioalijgr7kbrufkg4xxqkvv
==> Already downloaded /rss/spack/var/spack/stage/lua-luafilesystem-1_6_3-c2okue422sjfik3xncvoq3wu3plugekz/v_1_6_3.tar.gz
==> Already staged lua-luafilesystem-1_6_3-c2okue422sjfik3xncvoq3wu3plugekz in /rss/spack/var/spack/stage/lua-luafilesystem-1_6_3-c2okue422sjfik3xncvoq3wu3plugekz
==> No patches needed for lua-luafilesystem
==> Building lua-luafilesystem
==> '/rss/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/lua-5.3.2-wkvqiqfuvioalijgr7kbrufkg4xxqkvv/bin/luarocks' '--tree=/rss/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/lua-luafilesystem-1_6_3-c2okue422sjfik3xncvoq3wu3plugekz' 'install' '/rss/spack/var/spack/stage/lua-luafilesystem-1_6_3-c2okue422sjfik3xncvoq3wu3plugekz/luafilesystem-v_1_6_3/rockspecs/luafilesystem-1.6.3-1.rockspec'
Using /rss/spack/var/spack/stage/lua-luafilesystem-1_6_3-c2okue422sjfik3xncvoq3wu3plugekz/luafilesystem-v_1_6_3/rockspecs/luafilesystem-1.6.3-1.rockspec... switching to 'build' mode
Cloning into 'luafilesystem'...
error: unable to find 0a82aae451c5c95ceacb5fcb235f4d1ea964f5f5
fatal: object of unexpected type
fatal: index-pack failed

Error: Failed cloning git repository.
==> WRITE LOCK: /rss/spack/opt/spack/.spack-db/prefix_lock[814682083189999914:1] [Released]
==> WRITE LOCK: /rss/spack/var/spack/stage/.lock[8328219156727360566:1] [Released]
==> Error: Command exited with status 1:
'/rss/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/lua-5.3.2-wkvqiqfuvioalijgr7kbrufkg4xxqkvv/bin/luarocks' '--tree=/rss/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/lua-luafilesystem-1_6_3-c2okue422sjfik3xncvoq3wu3plugekz' 'install' '/rss/spack/var/spack/stage/lua-luafilesystem-1_6_3-c2okue422sjfik3xncvoq3wu3plugekz/luafilesystem-v_1_6_3/rockspecs/luafilesystem-1.6.3-1.rockspec'

See build log for details:
  /tmp/hartzelg/spack-stage/spack-stage-P6RM_H/luafilesystem-v_1_6_3/spack-build.out

/rss/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/lua-luafilesystem/package.py:51, in install:
     45       def install(self, spec, prefix):
     46           rockspec_fmt = join_path(self.stage.path,
     47                                    'luafilesystem-v_{version.underscored}',
     48                                    'rockspecs',
     49                                    'luafilesystem-{version.dotted}-1.rockspec')
     50           luarocks('--tree=' + prefix, 'install',
  >> 51                    rockspec_fmt.format(version=self.spec.version))
==> Error: Installation process had nonzero exit code : 256
```

Here's spack-build.out:

```
[hartzelg@rss-spack spack]$ cat /tmp/hartzelg/spack-stage/spack-stage-P6RM_H/luafilesystem-v_1_6_3/spack-build.out
==> '/rss/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/lua-5.3.2-wkvqiqfuvioalijgr7kbrufkg4xxqkvv/bin/luarocks' '--tree=/rss/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/lua-luafilesystem-1_6_3-c2okue422sjfik3xncvoq3wu3plugekz' 'install' '/rss/spack/var/spack/stage/lua-luafilesystem-1_6_3-c2okue422sjfik3xncvoq3wu3plugekz/luafilesystem-v_1_6_3/rockspecs/luafilesystem-1.6.3-1.rockspec'
Using /rss/spack/var/spack/stage/lua-luafilesystem-1_6_3-c2okue422sjfik3xncvoq3wu3plugekz/luafilesystem-v_1_6_3/rockspecs/luafilesystem-1.6.3-1.rockspec... switching to 'build' mode
Cloning into 'luafilesystem'...
error: unable to find 0a82aae451c5c95ceacb5fcb235f4d1ea964f5f5
fatal: object of unexpected type
fatal: index-pack failed

Error: Failed cloning git repository.
```

I can't quite figure out what's being cloned to generate the failure.  _luafilesystem-1.6.3-1.rockspec_ refers to `git://github.com/keplerproject/luafilesystem`, which I can clone successfully: 

```
[hartzelg@rss-spack spack]$ git clone git://github.com/keplerproject/luafilesystem
Cloning into 'luafilesystem'...
remote: Counting objects: 1554, done.
remote: Total 1554 (delta 0), reused 0 (delta 0), pack-reused 1553
Receiving objects: 100% (1554/1554), 312.75 KiB | 0 bytes/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (698/698), done.
```

and when I do it has a very different number of objects than whatever's imploding.

Any suggestions before I go spelunking?
title: Conflict between Spack and Lua auto-builders
